field.note: In order for the form to display e-commerce functionality it has to be linked to an e-commerce gateway. Otherwise it will act as a normal custom form.

section.name: Asset Purchase

field.note: This is the name of the request variable that will be used to pass the asset id to be purchased. If the value of this variable is 'add_to_cart' for example, then calling this asset with 'URL?add_to_cart=123' will try to add asset with id 123 to the checkout if it satisfies the required conditions.

This is the name of the request variable that will be used to pass the quantity of asset to be purchased. If the value of this variable is 'add_quantity' for example, then calling this asset with 'URL?add_quantity=10' will try to add 10 assets (supplied by above request var) to the checkout if it satisfies the multiplicity condition.

This string will be evaluated to construct a price. You can use any keyword available on the asset being purchased. If the evaluated price source string generates a number, that number will be used as item price, rounded to 2 decimal places.

This string will be evaluated to determine if an asset being purchased is taxable. You can use any keyword available on the asset being purchased. If this string evaluates to a non-empty value, the item is considered taxable.

This string will be evaluated to obtain the item name for the asset being purchased. You can use any keyword available on that asset. If this string evaluates to an empty string, asset name will be used. This option is provided because you might want to construct a name from a few keywords.

This string will be evaluated to determine if multiples of an asset can be purchased at once (i.e. 5 items in one checkout). You can use any keyword available on that asset. If this string evaluates to an empty string, multiples are not allowed.

section.note: This section allows you to make any asset in the system purchasable. When an asset is being purchased, it will be added to the list of items generated by ecommerce rules.

field.note:
This string will be evaluated to determine the reference ID of the purchase. The value of this string will be used as the EPS_REFERENCEID value during the transaction with the Payment Gateway. We recommend you to use one of the following keywords to keep the value as unique as possible:
  • %current_time% - this keyword will be replaced with the current time
  • %session_id% - this keyword will be replaced with the current session id
